public_fork_note: This protocol describes a completely different approach to electroporation of Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381), described in Ono et al., 2011. The previous electroporation protocol described was unsuccessful in effectively producing transformants.
description: Electroporation strategy used in the transformation of Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381; Stramenopile/ Heterokont, Thraustochytrid). This protocol is following the guidance of Ono et al. 2011. US Patent # 7,888,123 B2.

materials.reagent_name: Gene Pulser Electroporation Cuvettes, 0.2 cm gap

protocol_affiliation: State University of New York at Stony Brook

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

authors_list.name: Mariana Rius
authors_list.affiliation: State University of New York at Stony Brook

authors_list.name: Jackie Collier
authors_list.affiliation: State University of New York at Stony Brook

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working!

components.data:
Start a preculture 96 -120 h (4-5 days) prior to electroporation by inoculating 4 ml of GPY (0.5% Yeast Extract, 1% Peptone, 3% D+-Glucose, 1.8% instant ocean) with a colony of Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381). Incubate overnight at 28 C in the outermost ring of spinning drum.

Use preculture to inoculate 46 ml of GPY in 250 ml flask. Culture for 3 to 4 days at 28 C, 171 rpm.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Start a preculture 96 -120 h (4-5 days) prior to electroporation by inoculating 4 ml of GPY (0.5% Yeast Extract, 1% Peptone, 3% D+-Glucose, 1.8% instant ocean) with a colony of Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381). Incubate overnight at 28 C in the outermost ring of spinning drum.

Use preculture to inoculate 46 ml of GPY in 250 ml flask. Culture for 3 to 4 days at 28 C, 171 rpm.

components.data:
For electroporation reactions in which linear DNA plasmid will be used:

Linearize 10ug of plasmid for each electroporation reaction and clean using PCR purification (QIAGEN) eluting to ~12 ul*.

 

For electroporation reactions in which circular DNA plasmid will be used:

Concentrate DNA to 1ug/ul by PCR purification (QIAGEN) eluting to ~12 ul*.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 2 of Electroporation of Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381)
source_data.annotation: *~2 to 3 ul elution buffer will be bound to spin column, elution of 12 - 13 ul will result in final volume ~10ul.
source_data.thread_text: *~2 to 3 ul elution buffer will be bound to spin column, elution of 12 - 13 ul will result in final volume ~10ul.
source_data.body: *~2 to 3 ul elution buffer will be bound to spin column, elution of 12 - 13 ul will result in final volume ~10ul.

components.data:
Count cells.
Dilute 100 ul of culture in 900ul and load 10 ul on hemocytometer. Allow cells to settle for 2 - 5 min. Calculate cell count using recommended hemocytometer practice. Cell density should be ~ 5 x10^-4 cells/ul (~ 5 x10^-7 cells/ml). 

 

Pellet and rinse cells. 

Add 1.5 ml of cell culture to a microcentrifuge tube for each electroporation reaction. Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 500 ul chilled 1X BSS (10 mM KCl, 10 mM NaCl, and 3 mM CaCl2).  Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 500 ul chilled 50 mM sucrose. Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 500 ul chilled 50 mM sucrose. Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 100 ul chilled 50 mM sucrose. Resuspend by scraping cell mass off side of tube and vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Count cells.
Dilute 100 ul of culture in 900ul and load 10 ul on hemocytometer. Allow cells to settle for 2 - 5 min. Calculate cell count using recommended hemocytometer practice. Cell density should be ~ 5 x10^-4 cells/ul (~ 5 x10^-7 cells/ml). 

 

Pellet and rinse cells. 

Add 1.5 ml of cell culture to a microcentrifuge tube for each electroporation reaction. Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 500 ul chilled 1X BSS (10 mM KCl, 10 mM NaCl, and 3 mM CaCl2).  Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 500 ul chilled 50 mM sucrose. Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 500 ul chilled 50 mM sucrose. Centrifuge 5 min, 4 C, 11000rpm. 

Decant. Add 100 ul chilled 50 mM sucrose. Resuspend by scraping cell mass off side of tube and vortex.

components.data:
Add 10 ul (10ug) DNA to suspended cells. Incubate on ice 5 min. Transfer to chilled electroporation cuvette (0.2cm; BioRad). Keep on ice.

 

For 'no DNA' control 10 ul elution buffer is added to cells instead of DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add 10 ul (10ug) DNA to suspended cells. Incubate on ice 5 min. Transfer to chilled electroporation cuvette (0.2cm; BioRad). Keep on ice.

 

For 'no DNA' control 10 ul elution buffer is added to cells instead of DNA.

components.data: Dry electrodes upon removing electroporation cuvette from ice. Load into electroporation chamber. Set voltage 0.45 kV, capacitance 125 uF, and resistance 1000 Ω on Gene Pulser (BioRad). Clear surroundings and initiate pulse. Record time constant (τ; ~4 to 6 msec). Remove cuvette from chamber upon completion of pulse administration and return cuvette to ice. Proceed to next sample until all have been electroporated.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dry electrodes upon removing electroporation cuvette from ice. Load into electroporation chamber. Set voltage 0.45 kV, capacitance 125 uF, and resistance 1000 Ω on Gene Pulser (BioRad). Clear surroundings and initiate pulse. Record time constant (τ; ~4 to 6 msec). Remove cuvette from chamber upon completion of pulse administration and return cuvette to ice. Proceed to next sample until all have been electroporated.

components.data:
Label one microcentrifuge tube for each electroporated sample.

Add 1ml GPYS media to cuvette and transfer entire volume to microcentrifuge tube.

Incubate at 28 C, 1 h. No shaking is necessary.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Label one microcentrifuge tube for each electroporated sample.

Add 1ml GPYS media to cuvette and transfer entire volume to microcentrifuge tube.

Incubate at 28 C, 1 h. No shaking is necessary.

components.data:
Centrifuge cells for 5 min, room temperature, 11000rpm. Remove 1 ml supernatant. Resuspend remaining cells by scraping pellet off side of tube and vortexing. Plate remaining volume (<200ul) on GPYS zeocin (100ug/ml) amp (100ug/ml) plate. Incubate at 28 C.

 

If 'no DNA' control was used:

For calculating cell survivorship:

   Dilute to ~7.5x10^3 cells/100 ul and plate 100 ul (expected cells ~ 7500, but usually >80% mortality).

 

   Example dilutions:

   (Transformed and pelleted cells, resuspended in approximately 100ul ~7.5x10^7 cells)

   Take 10 ul cells and dilute in 990ul of1/2 artificial seawater (ASW) or GPYS

   (100x dilution ~ 7.5x10^4 cells)

   Take 10 ul of 100x dilution in 90 ul 1/2 ASW or GPYS.

   (10x dilution ~ 7.5x10^3 cells)

   Plate all 100 ul of 10x dilution.

 

For control on antibiotic selection:

   Plate remaining 'no DNA' control cells on GPYS zeocin amp plate as negative control.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Centrifuge cells for 5 min, room temperature, 11000rpm. Remove 1 ml supernatant. Resuspend remaining cells by scraping pellet off side of tube and vortexing. Plate remaining volume (<200ul) on GPYS zeocin (100ug/ml) amp (100ug/ml) plate. Incubate at 28 C.

 

If 'no DNA' control was used:

For calculating cell survivorship:

   Dilute to ~7.5x10^3 cells/100 ul and plate 100 ul (expected cells ~ 7500, but usually >80% mortality).

 

   Example dilutions:

   (Transformed and pelleted cells, resuspended in approximately 100ul ~7.5x10^7 cells)

   Take 10 ul cells and dilute in 990ul of1/2 artificial seawater (ASW) or GPYS

   (100x dilution ~ 7.5x10^4 cells)

   Take 10 ul of 100x dilution in 90 ul 1/2 ASW or GPYS.

   (10x dilution ~ 7.5x10^3 cells)

   Plate all 100 ul of 10x dilution.

 

For control on antibiotic selection:

   Plate remaining 'no DNA' control cells on GPYS zeocin amp plate as negative control.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 7 of Electroporation of Aurantiochytrium limacinum (ATCC MYA-1381)
source_data.annotation:
Plates will have visible cell mass because of the significant quantity of cells plated. Transformant colonies will appear over the plated cell mass.

 

Calculate cell survivorship using the plate containing diluted control cells on GPYS plate (no antibiotic selection).
source_data.thread_text:
Plates will have visible cell mass because of the significant quantity of cells plated. Transformant colonies will appear over the plated cell mass.

 

Calculate cell survivorship using the plate containing diluted control cells on GPYS plate (no antibiotic selection).

Plates will have visible cell mass because of the significant quantity of cells plated. Transformant colonies will appear over the plated cell mass.

 

Calculate cell survivorship using the plate containing diluted control cells on GPYS plate (no antibiotic selection).

components.data:
Colonies of control cells plated on GPYS (no antibiotic selection) will appear in 2 days from electroporation. 

Aurantiochytrium limacinum transformant colonies will appear between 3-5 days following electroporation. Streak transformant colonies onto GPYS zeocin/amp plate and monitor for transformation efficiency. Include wildtype for comparison.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Colonies of control cells plated on GPYS (no antibiotic selection) will appear in 2 days from electroporation. 

Aurantiochytrium limacinum transformant colonies will appear between 3-5 days following electroporation. Streak transformant colonies onto GPYS zeocin/amp plate and monitor for transformation efficiency. Include wildtype for comparison.

components.data:
Make GPYS media (3% glucose, 0.6% peptone, 0.2% yeast extract, 50mM sucrose, 1.8% instant ocean)

Make GPYS  ampiciln (100ug/ml) plates (2%agar)

Make GPYS zeocin (100ug.ml) and ampiciln (100ug/ml) plates (2%agar)

Make 1X BSS (10 mM KCl, 10 mM NaCl, and 3 mM CaCl2)

Make 50 mM sucrose solution 

 

Sterilize by autoclave or filter sterilization as appropraite.

Make 50 mM sucrose solution 

 

Sterilize by autoclave or filter sterilization as appropraite.
